subclassFeature.name: Oath of Sanctuary
entries: Paladins who swear the Oath of Sanctuary dedicate themselves to the protection of the weak, the preservation of life, and the maintenance of peace. They believe that a true warrior is not one who seeks battle, but one who stands firm in defense of those who cannot protect themselves. These paladins use their divine gifts to create sanctuaries of safety and peace wherever they tread, shielding others from harm and bringing calm to even the most dangerous situations.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: All eyes on Me
entries: You can as an action use your channel divinity to force every enemy within 30 feet from you to make a Wisdom saving throw. This effect fails against non-sentient creatures on a fail save they have a disadvantage on attack rolls against everyone but you for 1 minute.  On a successful save, the creature's speed is halved for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Desperate protection
entries: As a bonus action, you can bolster injured creatures with your Channel Divinity. Each creature of your choice that can hear you within 30 feet of you regains hit points equal to 1d8 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Additionally, you end one condition that may be affecting the target.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Sanctuary
entries: The tenets of the Oath of Sanctuary emphasize the protection of life and the pursuit of peace above all else. Paladins who swear this oath abide by these core principles:

entries.name: Protection
entries: Your first and foremost responsibility is to protect everyone in your immediate care. You must remain at the side of those entrusted to your care rather than seek revenge or justice.

entries.name: At All Costs
entries: You must do everything possible to protect those in your care, even if it means sacrificing yourself or others outside your care. Putting those under your care comes above you at all costs.

entries.name: Loyalty
entries: Once you have committed yourself to protecting an individual, you must protect them until the terms of your contract or other agreement are done. You cannot willingly end it.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Protector
entries: At the 7th level, you ensure the allies closest to you have extra protection from harm. When an ally is within 10 feet you can increase their AC by +2 as they are protected by your warmth. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Spirit
entries: Your presence has become a symbol of ease and protection to those around you. At the 15th level, you can choose a single target at the start of combat granting your grace upon them. For the rest of combat or until you are incapacitated the protected target gains the following bonus if they remain within 15 feet of you:

items: Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects
Resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning from non-magical weapons.
When the target takes damage, you can use your reaction to mitigate the damage equivalent to a charisma modifier. (Minimum of 1)

subclassFeature.name: Divine Ascent
entries: At 20th level, you can assume the form of a divine protector, taking on an angelic appearance. Using your action, you undergo a transformation for 1 minute, gaining the following benefits:

items: Wings sprout from your back, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet.
You emanate an aura of radiant light within a 30-foot radius, imbuing you and your allies' attacks with radiant energy and dealing an additional 1d6 radiant damage upon a successful attack.
Enemies that end their turn within the aura must make a Constitution saving throw upon a fail saved the creature takes damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1)

entries: This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
